job_title: Lead Ambassador in Staten Island, NY
pros: Everyone is really nice. The admissions counselors were super helpful and always very understanding. I loved working at the Admissions Office.
cons: I was a student, so no cons that I saw.

job_title: Assistant Director in Staten Island, NY
pros: Worked with wonderful colleagues. Beautiful campus
cons: No room for growth. Very little support.

job_title: Associate Professor in Staten Island, NY
pros: The faculty are caring and smart.
cons: The administration is finding its way.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Staten Island, NY
pros: Near Manhattan a lot of opportunities
cons: not enough money but free school

job_title: None Of Your Business! in Staten Island, NY
pros: Great people, good pay, folks are passionate, and the community is strong
cons: Being on Staten Island is a sometimes a bummer, food isn’t the best but what can ya do

job_title: Assistant Professor in Staten Island, NY
pros: cooperative, helpful, respectful, considerate colleagues
cons: information about procedures, protocols are at times difficult to discern

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Staten Island, NY
pros: Get my masters for free
cons: The place kind of sucks

job_title: Coordinator in Staten Island, NY
pros:
Campus is beautiful.
Great location if you are local to Staten Island.
Great balance of work/private life if you set boundaries with co-workers/administration.
cons:
No diversity or inclusion, no one knows boundaries, clicky, sneaky.
Ones that want to see change are alienated and/pushed out.
Passive aggressive, racist behavior.
Hiring and student recruitment is white washed.

job_title: IT Student Worker in Staten Island, NY
pros: Professional and chill work environment.
cons: There was always miscommunication with someone.

job_title: Resident Assistant (RA) in Staten Island, NY
pros: Very Organized, Good Structure, Task-Oriented, Transparency
cons: Heavy workload, Mediocre work environment, You are never off the clock working as a Resident Assistant

job_title: Video Coordinator in New York, NY
pros: You’re in New York City which is really cool. “Be part of the City”.. other than that it’s really tough
cons: You live in a freshman dorm, and they don’t tell your until you get there

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: N/A but interesting to say the least

job_title: Freelance Editor in New York, NY
pros: Flexible schedule, student employment that doesn’t require financial aid package
cons: Difficult course in order to apply

review_title: Feels like you're not on Staten Island anymore
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Staten Island, NY
pros: Beautiful well kept grounds, historical buildings that could use a little TLC definitely that private school feel to it.  Pretty much all of the employees here are very nice, respectable and professional.   Really a good place to work on Staten Island being that there aren't that many employment opportunities here other than Staten Island Hospital. Great opportunities for advancement in your education or the education of your children.
cons: Pay is pretty low but considering Staten Island doesn't offer much in terms of employment its acceptable.  Small campus so everyone knows everything!  Even if you don't think anyone notices anything trust me they are watching!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Staten Island, NY
pros: Wagner has an amazing staff dedicated to student success. Each day was a pleasure to report to work. My supervisor encouraged me to develop my strengths and share them with all members of campus.
cons: I have no cons to report. The environment was collegial, supportive, and nurturing, the compensation and benefits good, and I experienced the best work/life balance possible.

job_title: Writing Tutor in Staten Island, NY
pros: Fun to work with students. Great opportunity to read interesting papers and work with other students. I learned a lot from the papers I was tutoring, and the experience helped my people skills.
cons: You get paid very infrequently. The entire tutoring center can be very unorganized but at the same time you are working with some great people.

job_title: in New York, NY
pros: upper level management very competent, beautiful campus, excellent benefit package, many holidays off, located in NYC, room for advancement, fun staff
cons: some of the administration members are not very good at their jobs

job_title: Associate Professor in New York, NY
pros: The faculty are wonderful and care about doing good work for the most part. The benefits are good. Many of the students are wonderful people.
cons: Hard to afford NYC on the salary

job_title: Driver in Staten Island, NY
pros: flexibility, great co-workers  and easy run.
cons: part -time. no benefits  If they had full-time I would be there forever.

job_title: Head Coach in New York, NY
pros: Small School so you have close relationships with your seniors
cons: Small budget and little wiggle room to do change or do anything

review_title: Working on Staten Island and close to home

cons: Many events can be attended and schooling for free

job_title: Teacher/Administrator in New York, NY
